trans-unit.source: How to Use Apache Cordova Plugin for Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: How to Use Apache Cordova Plugin for Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: How to Use Apache Cordova Plugin for Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: How to Use Apache Cordova Plugin for Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: How to Use Apache Cordova Client Library for Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: How to Use Apache Cordova Client Library for Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: This guide teaches you to perform common scenarios using the latest [Apache Cordova Plugin for Azure Mobile Apps].
trans-unit.target: This guide teaches you to perform common scenarios using the latest [Apache Cordova Plugin for Azure Mobile Apps].

trans-unit.source: If you are new to Azure Mobile
trans-unit.target: If you are new to Azure Mobile

trans-unit.source: Apps, first complete [Azure Mobile Apps Quick Start] to create a backend, create a table, and download a pre-built Apache Cordova project.
trans-unit.target: Apps, first complete [Azure Mobile Apps Quick Start] to create a backend, create a table, and download a pre-built Apache Cordova project.

trans-unit.source: In this
trans-unit.target: In this

trans-unit.source: guide, we focus on the client-side Apache Cordova Plugin.
trans-unit.target: guide, we focus on the client-side Apache Cordova Plugin.

trans-unit.source: Setup and Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Setup and Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This guide assumes that you have created a backend with a table.
trans-unit.target: This guide assumes that you have created a backend with a table.

trans-unit.source: This guide assumes that the table has the same schema as the tables in those
trans-unit.target: This guide assumes that the table has the same schema as the tables in those

trans-unit.source: tutorials.
trans-unit.target: tutorials.

trans-unit.source: This guide also assumes that you have added the Apache Cordova Plugin to your code.
trans-unit.target: This guide also assumes that you have added the Apache Cordova Plugin to your code.

trans-unit.source: If you have not done so, you may add the Apache
trans-unit.target: If you have not done so, you may add the Apache

trans-unit.source: Cordova plugin to your project on the command-line:
trans-unit.target: Cordova plugin to your project on the command-line:

trans-unit.source: For more information on creating [your first Apache Cordova app], see their documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information on creating [your first Apache Cordova app], see their documentation.

trans-unit.source: How to: Authenticate Users
trans-unit.target: How to: Authenticate Users

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service supports authenticating and authorizing app users using a variety of external identity
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service supports authenticating and authorizing app users using a variety of external identity

trans-unit.source: providers: Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, and Twitter.
trans-unit.target: providers: Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, and Twitter.

trans-unit.source: You can set permissions on tables to restrict
trans-unit.target: You can set permissions on tables to restrict

trans-unit.source: access for specific operations to only authenticated users.
trans-unit.target: access for specific operations to only authenticated users.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the identity of authenticated
trans-unit.target: You can also use the identity of authenticated

trans-unit.source: users to implement authorization rules in server scripts.
trans-unit.target: users to implement authorization rules in server scripts.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Get started with authentication] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Get started with authentication] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: When using authentication in an Apache Cordova app, the following Cordova plugins must be available:
trans-unit.target: When using authentication in an Apache Cordova app, the following Cordova plugins must be available:

trans-unit.source: cordova-plugin-device
trans-unit.target: cordova-plugin-device

trans-unit.source: cordova-plugin-inappbrowser
trans-unit.target: cordova-plugin-inappbrowser

trans-unit.source: Two authentication flows are supported: a server flow and a client flow.
trans-unit.target: Two authentication flows are supported: a server flow and a client flow.

trans-unit.source: The server flow provides the simplest
trans-unit.target: The server flow provides the simplest

trans-unit.source: authentication experience, as it relies on the provider's web authentication interface.
trans-unit.target: authentication experience, as it relies on the provider's web authentication interface.

trans-unit.source: The client flow allows
trans-unit.target: The client flow allows

trans-unit.source: for deeper integration with device-specific capabilities such as single-sign-on as it relies on provider-specific
trans-unit.target: for deeper integration with device-specific capabilities such as single-sign-on as it relies on provider-specific

trans-unit.source: device-specific SDKs.
trans-unit.target: device-specific SDKs.

trans-unit.source: How to: Configure your Mobile App Service for External Redirect URLs.
trans-unit.target: How to: Configure your Mobile App Service for External Redirect URLs.

trans-unit.source: Several types of Apache Cordova applications use a loopback capability to handle OAuth UI flows.
trans-unit.target: Several types of Apache Cordova applications use a loopback capability to handle OAuth UI flows.

trans-unit.source: This causes problems
trans-unit.target: This causes problems

trans-unit.source: since the authentication service only knows how to utilize your service by default.
trans-unit.target: since the authentication service only knows how to utilize your service by default.

trans-unit.source: Examples of this are using the Ripple
trans-unit.target: Examples of this are using the Ripple

trans-unit.source: emulator, running your service locally or in a different Azure App Service but redirecting to the Azure App Service for
trans-unit.target: emulator, running your service locally or in a different Azure App Service but redirecting to the Azure App Service for

trans-unit.source: authentication, or Live Reload with Ionic.
trans-unit.target: authentication, or Live Reload with Ionic.

trans-unit.source: Follow these instructions to add your local settings to the configuration:
trans-unit.target: Follow these instructions to add your local settings to the configuration:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal]
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal]

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Tools**
trans-unit.target: Click on **Tools**

trans-unit.source: Click on **Resource explorer** in the OBSERVE menu, then click on **Go**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Resource explorer** in the OBSERVE menu, then click on **Go**.

trans-unit.source: A new window or tab will open.
trans-unit.target: A new window or tab will open.

trans-unit.source: Expand the **config**, **authsettings** nodes for your site in the left hand navigation.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **config**, **authsettings** nodes for your site in the left hand navigation.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Edit**
trans-unit.target: Click on **Edit**

trans-unit.source: Look for the "allowedExternalRedirectUrls" element.
trans-unit.target: Look for the "allowedExternalRedirectUrls" element.

trans-unit.source: It will be set to null.
trans-unit.target: It will be set to null.

trans-unit.source: Change it to the following:
trans-unit.target: Change it to the following:

trans-unit.source: Replace the URLs with the URLs of your service.
trans-unit.target: Replace the URLs with the URLs of your service.

trans-unit.source: Examples include "http://localhost:3000" (for the Node.js sample
trans-unit.target: Examples include "http://localhost:3000" (for the Node.js sample

trans-unit.source: service), or "http://localhost:4400" (for the Ripple service).
trans-unit.target: service), or "http://localhost:4400" (for the Ripple service).

trans-unit.source: However, these are examples - your situation,
trans-unit.target: However, these are examples - your situation,

trans-unit.source: including for the services mentioned in the examples, may be different.
trans-unit.target: including for the services mentioned in the examples, may be different.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Read/Write** button in the top-right corner of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Read/Write** button in the top-right corner of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click on the green **PUT** button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the green **PUT** button.

trans-unit.source: The settings will be saved at this point.
trans-unit.target: The settings will be saved at this point.

trans-unit.source: Do not close the browser window until the settings have finished saving.
trans-unit.target: Do not close the browser window until the settings have finished saving.

trans-unit.source: You will also need to add these loopback URLs to the CORS settings:
trans-unit.target: You will also need to add these loopback URLs to the CORS settings:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal]
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal]

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: The Settings blade will open automatically.
trans-unit.target: The Settings blade will open automatically.

trans-unit.source: If it doesn't, click on **All Settings**.
trans-unit.target: If it doesn't, click on **All Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **CORS** under the API menu.
trans-unit.target: Click on **CORS** under the API menu.

trans-unit.source: Enter the URL that you wish to add in the box provided and press Enter.
trans-unit.target: Enter the URL that you wish to add in the box provided and press Enter.

trans-unit.source: Enter additional URLs as needed.
trans-unit.target: Enter additional URLs as needed.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Save** to save the settings.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Save** to save the settings.

trans-unit.source: It will take approximately 10-15 seconds for the new settings to take effect.
trans-unit.target: It will take approximately 10-15 seconds for the new settings to take effect.

trans-unit.source: How to: Register for Push Notifications
trans-unit.target: How to: Register for Push Notifications

trans-unit.source: Install the [phonegap-plugin-push] to handle push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Install the [phonegap-plugin-push] to handle push notifications.

trans-unit.source: This can be easily added using the `cordova plugin add`
trans-unit.target: This can be easily added using the `cordova plugin add`

trans-unit.source: command on the command line, or via the Git plugin installer within Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: command on the command line, or via the Git plugin installer within Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: The following code in your Apache
trans-unit.target: The following code in your Apache

trans-unit.source: Cordova app will register your device for push notifications:
trans-unit.target: Cordova app will register your device for push notifications:

trans-unit.source: Use the Notification Hubs SDK to send push notifications from the server.
trans-unit.target: Use the Notification Hubs SDK to send push notifications from the server.

trans-unit.source: You should never
trans-unit.target: You should never

trans-unit.source: send push notifications directly from clients as that could be used to trigger a denial of
trans-unit.target: send push notifications directly from clients as that could be used to trigger a denial of

trans-unit.source: service attack against Notification Hubs or the PNS.
trans-unit.target: service attack against Notification Hubs or the PNS.
